q: In our Chalk Talk with Avocent CTO Ben Grimes, we get a first-hand look at some of the challenges with managing power, including a look at some of the tools Avocent offers to help with this. is a net positive." Turning to the bigger picture, Eric Schmidt collects his thoughts for a moment. "I can only describe this now as a "wow" moment," he says. For me this is the beginning of the real revolution in information. "You need never be lonely, you need never be bored. It is a remarkable change that has not been led by and is not just for the Western elites- it is all-pervasive with a declining cost. "We are just at the beginning of hearing the voices who are starting to come online. I feel that we have made a material change in the lives of literally billions of people. The convergence of search, location and social is the next big narrative. Although Eric Schmidt is stepping down as chief executive, Google said he will take on the role of Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership-- all of which are increasingly important given Google's global reach. Internally, he will continue to act as an advisor to Larry and Sergey Brin . "With everything going on, I wanted to play well," Allen Iverson said. I just wanted to play well. Especially for my teammates because I let them down by not being here. Allen Iverson was benched by Pistons coach Michael Beasley Curry to begin the game, punishment for missing a mandatory team practice on Thanksgiving.
